<description type="note">Title: The announcement to the three Maries.
Genre: English mystery and miracle plays.

finem 1a dic Nota hic uenient ad sepulcrum maria magdalene maria jacobi et maria Salome et dicit maria magdalene Magdalen Swete systeryn I ?ow besech heryght now my specyal speche Go we with salvys ffor to leche Cryst Ã¾at tholyd wounde he hath us wonnyn owt of wreche the ryght wey god wyl us teche ffor to seke my lorde my leche his blood hath me vnbownde. vij develys in me were pyght my loue my lord my god Almyght A-wey he weryd Ã¾o ffyndys wight with his wyse wurde he droff fro me Ã¾e fendes lees in my swete sowle his chawmere I ches In me be-levyth Ã¾e lord of pes I go to his burryenge boorde. Maria jacobi My systerys sone I woot he was he lyth in here as sunne in glas Ã¾e childe was born by oxe and Asse Vp in a bestys stall thow his body be gravyd vndyr gres Ã¾e grete godhede is nevyr-Ã¾e-lasse Ã¾e lord xal rysyn and gon his pas and comfortyn his ffrendys all. Maria Salome My name is mary Salome his modyr and I systerys we be Annys dowterys we be all thre Jhesu we be Ã¾in Awntys The naylis gun his lemys feyn and Ã¾e spere gan punche and peyn on Ã¾o woundys we wold haue eyn Ã¾at grace now god graunt vs. Maria Magdalene Now go we stylle with good wyll Ã¾er he is leyd he deyd on crowch we wolde hym towch as we han seyd. Tunc respicit maria magdalene in sepulcro dicens Where is my lord Ã¾at was here Ã¾at for me bledde bowndyn in brere his body was beryed rygh by Ã¾is mere Ã¾at Ffor me gan deye Ã¾e jewys ffekyll and ffals ffownde where haue Ã¾ei do Ã¾e body with wounde he lyth not upon Ã¾is grownde Ã¾e body is don A-weye. Maria jacobi To my lorde my love my ffrende Ffayn wolde I salve A spende and I myght aught A-mende his woundys depe and wyde to my lord I owe lowlyte both homage and fewte I wolde with my dewte a softyd hand and syde. Maria Salome To myghtfful god omnypotent I bere a boyst of oynement I wold han softyd his sore dent his sydys al a-bowte Lombe of love with-owt loth I ffynde Ã¾e not myn hert is wroth in Ã¾e sepulcre Ã¾er lyth a cloth And jentyl jhesu is owte. Angelus wendyth fforth ?e women thre In-to Ã¾e strete of Galyle ?our savyour Ã¾er xul ?e se walkynge in Ã¾e waye ?our Ffleschly lorde now hath lyff Ã¾at deyd on tre with strook and stryff wende fforth Ã¾ou wepynge wyff and seke hym I Ã¾e saye. Now goth fforth ffast all thre to his dyscyplys ffayr and fre and to petyr Ã¾e trewth telle ?e Ã¾er of haue ?e no dreed Spare ?e not Ã¾e soth to say he Ã¾at was deed and closyd in clay he is resyn Ã¾is same day And levyth with woundys reed. Maria Magdalen A myrthe and joye in herte we haue Ffor now is resyn out of his graue he levyth now oure lyf to saue Ã¾at dede lay in Ã¾e clay Maria jacoby In hert I was ryght sore dysmayd the Aungel to us whan Ã¾at he sayd Ã¾at cryst is resyn I was affrayd Ã¾e Aungel whan I say Maria Salome Now lete us all thre fulfylle Ã¾e Angelys wurde and goddys wylle lett us sey with voys wul shrylle Cryst Ã¾at jewys dede sle oure lord Ã¾at naylyd was on Ã¾e rode And betyn out was his bodyes blode he is a-resyn Ã¾ough they ben wode A lorde ?itt wele Ã¾ou be. Maria magdalene dicit petro et ceteris apostolis. Bretheryn all in herte be glad bothe blythe And joyful in herte ful fayn Ffor ryght good tydandys haue we had Ã¾at oure lord is resyn Agayn An Aungel us bad ryght Ã¾us sertayn to Ã¾e petyr Ã¾at we xulde telle how cryst is resyn Ã¾e which was slayn A levynge man evyr more to dwelle. Maria jacobi To lyve is resyn a-geyn Ã¾at lorde the qwych judas to jewys solde of Ã¾is I bere ryght trewe recorde by wurdys Ã¾at Ã¾e Aungel tolde now myrth and joye to man on molde Euery man now myrth may haue he Ã¾at was closyd in cley ful colde This day is resyn owt of his grave Petrus Sey me systeryn with wurdys blythe may I troste to Ã¾at ?e say Is cryst resyn ageyn to lyve Ã¾at was ded and colde in clay. Maria Salome ?a trostyth us truly it is no nay he is a-resyn it is no les and so An Aungel us tolde Ã¾is day with opyn voys and speche expres. Johannes ?a Ã¾ese be tydyngys of ryght gret blys Ã¾at oure mayster resyn xulde be I wyl go renne in hast i-wys and loke my lord yf I may se. Petrus Ffor joye also I renne with the my brothyr johan as I Ã¾e say In hast anon evyn forth go we to his grave we renne oure way. hic currunt Johannes et Petrus simul ad sepulcrum et Johannes prius venit Ad monumentum sed non intrat. Johannes The same shete here I se Ã¾at crystys body was in wounde but he is gon where so ever he be he lyth not here up on Ã¾is grownde. Petrus intrat monumentum et dicit Petrus Petrus in Ã¾is cornere Ã¾e shete is fownde and here we fynde Ã¾e sudary In Ã¾e whiche his hed was wounde whan he was take from calvary. hic intrat Johannes monumentum dicens Johannes The same sudary and Ã¾e same shete here with my syth I se both tweyn now may I wele knowe and wete Ã¾at he is rysyn to lyve ageyn On to oure bretheryn lete us go seyn Ã¾e trewth ryght hevyn as it is Oure mayster lyvyth Ã¾e whech was slayn All myghty lorde and kynge of blys. Petrus No lengere here wyll we dwelle to oure bretheryn Ã¾e wey we take the trewth to them whan Ã¾at we telle grett joye in hert Ã¾an wul Ã¾ei make. hic petrus loquitur omnibus apostolis simul collectis Beth mery bretheryn for Crystys sake Ã¾at man Ã¾at is oure mayster so good Ffrom deth to lyve he is A-wake Ã¾at sore was rent up on Ã¾e rood. Johannes As women seyd so haue we fownde remevyd Awey we saw Ã¾e ston he lyth no lengere vndyr Ã¾e grownde out of his graue oure mayster is gon. Omnes congregati Thomas We haue grett woundyr everychon of Ã¾ese wurdys Ã¾at ?e do speke A ston ful hevy lay hym up on Ffrom vndyr Ã¾at ston how xulde he breke. Petrus The trewth to tellyn it passyth oure witt Wethyr he be resyn thorwe his owyn myght Or ellys stolyn out of his pitt be sum man prevely be nyght That he is gon we saw with syght Ffor in his graue he is nowth we can not tellyn in what plyght Out of his graue Ã¾at he is browth.
